riddle: The person who makes it has no need of it; the person who buys it has no use for it. The person who uses it can neither see nor feel it. What is it?
hint: Used only once, never by choice.

riddle: Until I am measured, I am not known. Yet how you miss me, when I have flown. What am I?
hint: You can't hold me, but you always feel me pass.

riddle: What has many keys but cannot open a single lock?
hint: Its notes unlock emotions, not doors.

riddle: What can go up a chimney down, but can’t go down a chimney up?
hint: It changes shape with a button and hates being closed the wrong way.
You can hear me howl, but never see my form.

riddle: How many Friday the 13ths can there be in one calendar year?
hint: Think of the worst-case scenario — it’s surprisingly possible.

riddle: I speak without a mouth and listen without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
hint: I'm your ghost in a canyon.

riddle: The more you take from me, the bigger I become. What am I?
I have lakes but no water, roads but no cars, and mountains but no land. What am I?
hint: I hold the world in two dimensions.

riddle: I turn once, what is out will not get in. I turn again, what is in will not get out. What am I?
hint: A small twist can unlock a world — or seal it.
